2020.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2017 (S.I. No. 366 of 2017)), in
heading: It is hereby declared that the national minimum hourly rate of pay for
text_raw:
2. 

It is hereby declared that the national minimum hourly rate of pay for 
the purposes of the National Minimum Wage Acts 2000 and 2015 shall be 
€10.10.
text_norm: 2 hereby declared national minimum hourly rate pay purpose national minimum wage act 2000 2015 shall eur10.10

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2017 (S.I. No. 366 of 2017)), in
heading: 3. The national minimum hourly rate of pay may include the following
text_raw:
3. The national minimum hourly rate of pay may include the following 

allowances: 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 17th January, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 (a) 

(b) 

for board only, €0.90 per hour worked, 

for lodgings only, €23.86 per week, or €3.42 per day. 

[8] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

14 January, 2020. 

REGINA DOHERTY, 

Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [8]

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2017 (S.I. No. 366 of 2017)), in
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

This Order sets the national minimum hourly rate of pay from 1 February 2020 
at €10.10, and the board and lodging rates as follows; 

• Lodgings: €23.86 per week, or €3.42 per day. 
• Board: €0.90 per hour worked. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [8] 5
